inn1.comm: full, swinging, Sidebottom on the mark straight away and that thuds into Tamim's pads
wide, Tamim throws his bat at this and it flies over what would have been third slip. Went really hard at that, thick edge
this darts in a touch, off the inside half of the bat to midwicket, where it's well fielded
good length, slightly wide and Tamim attempts to flay this through the off side, but can't connect. Not too much bounce for Sidebottom either.
straighter, Tamim moves inside it and works to leg, and they run a quick single
good line, not much bounce but a touch of away movement, and Kayes plays inside this one.
on his hips, tucked to leg and another easy single
excellent line, not much swing but right on offstump, and defended watchfully
he pushes this one wider, batsman has a full swing at it but can't connect. Very little bounce
Slightly shorter and straight again, met with an equally straight bat but they can't find a run
good line again, Bresnan keeping it tight in his first over, and this one's defended once again
short and hooked, but he gets a massive top edge on it and it flies a couple of metres over the top of Prior's head and away to the boundary
down leg, bad ball and given wide straight away
much better line, no swing though. Tamim has a drive at it but straight to the cover fielder
good once again from Sidebottom, slightly shorter but straight, and defended
Tamim has a full go at one just short of a length on offstump, but can't get a touch on it, play and miss
attempted pull to a shorter ball, but no pace in the pitch and the ball trickles to mid on
awesome shot, good length ball and he's driven that on the up through the covers. Onto the front foot and punched with great power and timing
Dropped!Full and very wide, Tamim has a full-blooded drive and hits it straight to Eoin Morgan who puts down a straightforward chance. It was hit very hard though
still keeping it tight is Bresnan, back of a length on off stump and defended
Bresnan's not giving the batsmen any room here, this one's straight again and defended
like a metronome is Bresnan, he's finding the right line and length and bowling very well here
Imrul finds some room, works this away down to third man off the off stump
great line again. Bresnan doing really well to keep the batsmen quiet. Defended
and once again, same line, same length, and there's nothing Tamim can do. Bresnan will be working on the batsmen's patience here
leg stump line, flicked off his pads down to deep square
short, 136.5kph, Tamim not comfortable against it, gets an inside edge which loops up off his hip but no damage done
Tamim aims an almighty heave at the next ball, which is pitched up, but it's bunted straight to mid on
short and wider outside off stump. Borderline as to whether it's wide, but the umpire says that's one for the over. Good short ball in the end I suppose
great shot! Graeme Swann gets half a hand on this at short extra cover, but the ball is powerfully slammed through cover with no foot movement and that's four
magnificent strike! Stand and deliver stuff, lofted high over long on for maximum
Bresnan restores some order with a back-of-a-length delivery worked casually down to third man for a single
maintains the shorter length and this is taken from just outside off stump and worked away to third man easily
good delivery, bang on off stump and can only be defended towards the covers
timed beautifully off the back foot, nothing more than a defensive push, it flew down to the point boundary where a sprawling stop from Sidebottom saved the four, good fielding
much shorter and the batsman sways out the way
flashing blade outside off stump, a little flat footed, as Kayes swishes at fresh air
starts very neatly, back of a length and bang on target, Iqbal stands tall and defends
well another short ball and a slightly streaky boundary from Iqbal, who continues to flash hard at any opportunity, top-edging a pull shot high over Prior's head for four
slightly ugly swipe outside off, flies off an inside edge to midwicket
better ball from Broad, fuller and on off stump, leaving no option but to defend
slower ball cutter from, aimed nicely, and the batsman leaves outside off
another attacking shot, but finds no timing and goes straight to Sidebottom at mid off
banged in on target, but high enough for the umpire to decide it's a wide. Bresnan is not amused
good delivery, on off stump and defended into the covers
well, what a shot this is! A fraction short from Bresnan and Iqbal leans back and thwacks it through midwicket for four
good follow-up shot, opening the face and guiding it to point with soft hands for a single
Kayes is into the action now, thrashing a short wide ball through point for four, top stuff
good recovery, full and much straighter, kept out easily enough
neatly guided down to third man to complete an excellent over for Bangladesh
neatly defended from a straight ball
much shorter, Broad trying to unearth some aggression, the batsman calmly sways inside the line
short again, and straight, but Kayes manages to squeeze it down to third man
well, Iqbal meeting fire with fire, short ball and Iqbal leant back and heaved it over midwicket. Not perfectly timed but might effective
brilliant stuff this from Iqbal, another short ball from Broad, quite why I don't know, and Iqbal rolled his wrists over his pull shot, guiding it past the short fine leg for another boundary
England under the cosh here, Broad switching to round the wicket but shoving it too far down leg
fantastic shot! This is sterling stuff from Iqbal. Judging the length and using the round-the-wicket angle to launch Broad over midwicket for an monstrous six!
Bresnan has bowled smartly here, not trying to be too aggressive, and continues with a tight line that is defended

gone this time, Bresnan strikes with a clever slower ball. Full and Kayes turned his wrists on it too early, found a leading edge that looped gently to Wright at mid on. Breaks an excellent opening stand
good delivery again, probing the off-stump line and defended
well, the wicket hasn't changed Iqbal's approach, slapping a shortish ball for four through midwicket
single brings up a fantastic fifty for Iqbal, from just 32 balls that has immediately shown England that Bangladesh won't roll over this tour
defended tidily into the off side
back of a length and angled through midwicket off the back foot
Broad, for reasons I can't work out, insists on banging the ball in, Iqbal hangs back and tries to heave this into the leg side, doesn't time it much but gets a single down to square leg

lucky break for England, Broad finally pitches it up, and Siddique clips a leg-stump half-volley straight to square leg. He was slightly deceived by the slower ball, but it was a soft dismissal that England really needed. Kieswetter was the catcher, his first contribution to international cricket
fuller again, and defended into the off side
turned into the leg side for a single
back of a length again, and worked towards the midwicket boundary for a single
well, Iqbal showing no signs of relenting, skips down the wicket and aims a massive swipe, timing it well, straight to Pietersen at mid off
nicely played, using the pace and angle of the delivery and dabbing a shortish ball to third man
ooops, Bresnan's gets this slightly wrong, the ball slipping out of his hand and goes over waist high, Ahmed prods it to square leg for one
good ball, slightly slower and dies on the way to Prior as Iqbal plays and misses
shades of Saeed Anwar, free-flowing, throwing his arms at width outside the off stump and it rockets through cover for another boundary
nicely done, follows the boundary with a dabs to third man for a single
big appeal from Bresnan, but a fairly lonely one as it clips the pads from a full ball and thuds away to the leg side
another one for England! Brilliant stuff from Pietersen, Ahmed guiding a fullish ball to mid on, where Pietersen was close in, he swoops and under-arms a flick in a flash on to the stumps
a hint of width, and Iqbal dispatches it imperiously through cover for four, another top shot
as he's done well all innings, follows up a boundary with a no-risk single
fuller and defended into the covers
good solid defensive from Shakib, rocking back and blocking into the off side
short ball, Shakib turns it off his hip down to fine leg for an easy single
for the first time today there is a hint of swing, back into the batsman from round the wicket, defended
drifts a fraction wider, allowing Shakib to flay his arms at it, but it goes straight to point
swing again, and full and straight, Shakib very correctly defends to mid on
fuller again, and a hint of movement once more, driven hard into the covers
Sidebottom lucky to get away with this, full toss drifting with the angle down the leg side, but shovelled straight to midwicket
well played, turning it with the angle into the leg side for a sharp, but well judged, single
full and Shakib times a firm push back down the ground well, but Broad neatly tumbles and saves it in his follow through
just going a little hard at the ball here, robbing Shakib of timing, as he tries to drive this fuller ball through the covers
slower ball, Shakib waits but his back-foot drive trickles into the covers
fuller and driven to Pietersen at mid off, who throws the ball straight back at the strikers end, narrowly missing Iqbal at the non-strikers, who is thoroughly unamused by it all
fuller and defended into the off side
completes a tidy over with Shakib pushing this firmly to mid off
slower ball from Sidebottom, Tamim plays it watchfully. He's so important to Bangladesh's innings from here on in
a hint of movement into the batsman there, good pace too at 134kph, and defended once again
width given, Shakib has a go at it and third man cleans up
full, wide half-volley the batsmen get through for one as Pietersen fields, but a sloppy return to Prior allows them to scurry through for a second
slower ball, much slower this time, but lots of width given again and Tamim plays an un-Tamim-like delicate late cut
angling in to the batsmen, tucked to midwicket but straight to the fielder
and he starts with a wild short, wide ball, but Tamim can't quite get it past point. They scamper through for one though.
fuller, driven in the air but through the gap through cover. He's very lucky to get away with that, as it would have been easily catchable if hit at a fielder. Sweeper cleans up as they run one
shorter, straight at the throat, but Tamim gives himself some room and plays it down to short third man
similar ball, and Tamim plays it down to short third man once again. Wants a single but Shakib sends him back
slower ball, but Broad just drifts into his pads and Tamim clips it behind square on the leg side
back of a length outside off, Tamim attempts to cut it away but chops an inside edge down to third man for a single instead. Fairly close to the stumps there, but no alarms in the end
flighted, but on Shakibs legs and he plays it down to long on with ease. No turn yet
he's really flighted this one, but Tamim doesn't take the bait, played down to long off
Shakib using his feet well. Intelligent batting and played down to long on for a single
there's some turn! Swann gives this one a real rip, and Tamim plays and misses on off stump
good batting again, he takes the single down to long off
Shakib drives this one through the covers and out to the sweeper, and they scamper through for the fifth single of the over.
good start from around the wicket, off cutter, slightly straight and Shakib works it away to leg for a single
over the wicket, and that's a very slow offcutter, just 61mph
slightly quicker, good ball on off stump and Tamim gets a thick outside edge on it and the ball rolls down to third man. Definitely not deliberately played
very, very slow, really flighted, but Tamim plays it watchfully down to long off
round the wicket to Shakib, a bit too straight though and he's able to work it to leg, a slight fumble gives them the chance to run through for one
ooh, Tamim thinks about the paddle sweep, but it's too far outside off and he adjusts to play it off the face, but the ball goes straight to short third man
moves across to off, and plays a cheeky paddle sweep. The ball takes the top edge but safely played in the end
flighted, with some turn on offer, and its played off the outside half down to third man

Gone! Shakib goes, Swann strikes in his second over! Shakib skips down the wicket and is done in by some drift and really sharp turn there. Prior makes no mistake with the stumping and the Bangladesh captain goes.
left alone outside off
on off stump and defended watchfully
fuller and Mushfiqur has a drive at this, but can't time it
full and Tamim drives it straight back down the ground but the ball crashes into the stumps at the non-strikers end. Colly almost got a hand to that
good ball again, slowing it up intelligently and Tamim can't get it away
driven into the covers, Pietersen eventually makes a good stop after stumbling over the ball a little. Batsmen don't risk the single, wisely
played straight back at Collingwood, no run
and again, full, straight, but met with an equally straight bat back at Collingwood
and he completes the maiden as Tamim attempts to flick this to leg, but gets a leading edge back to the bowler
flighted and Mushfiqur solid in defence
strongly swept down to long leg. Good shot as he's playing with the spin
Tamim makes room and plays the ball just to the right of Luke Wright at short third man, they really had to scamper there. very tight single as Mushfiqur dives to make his ground
watchful again, just tapped to mid on
whipped through midwicket, sensible shot really
turns and played down to short third man
just back of a length and slightly quicker, but Mushfiqur finds a gap in the covers and they pick up a single
around the wicket to the left-hander still, it's fullish and on off stump and Tamim plays the ball down to long off to enter the 80s
quicker but drifting down leg and on his toes. Mushfiqur plays the ball easily down to long on
false shot from Tamim, he's tried to loft one to leg but gets a big inside edge. Ball went in the air but in the gap thorugh square leg
slower ball, and the offcutter grips a little as the ball slips down leg, tucked to leg
whipped to leg again by Tamim to keep the strike
Spears one in, but Tamim defends
flighted and Tamim moves to off stump, waits on the ball and rolls his wrists over a good sweep to leg
Mushfiqur uses his feet and times the ball through the covers. Sidebottom allows the batsmen to come back for a second
has another sweep at a ball outside off, hit on the pads and Swann appeals, but hitting him way outside off
clipped but straight to mid on
uses his feet once again, played out to the sweeper on the off side. Mushfiqur looking good so far, but he needs to stay there
another gripping offcutter, this one really turns in but Mushfiqur defends it into the covers
same line and defended again.
on the spot once more and Mushfiqur can only defend
slips this one slightly too straight, allowing Mushfiqur to get inside it and find the gap between midwicket and square leg
same ball, but to the left-hander this time, and they steal another single
very slow, the ball grips the surface again and Mushfiqur works it off his pads to leg
a bit too short from Swann, Mushfiqur rocks back and swipes it down to long leg
drifting down leg, Tamim gets some bat on the sweep but it goes straight to fine leg
on his toes again, clipped out to midwicket and Tamim wants two, but wisely turned down
fairly wide outside off, played well behind point but a great diving stop by Wright saves the single
flighted and defended
Mushfiqur defends out to the covers, and finds the gap, allowing him to keep the strike for the next over.
really slow, Mushfiqur finds space in the covers and they scamper through
full ball driven back at Collingwood, who gets a hand on it but can't stop it. Pietersen runs round to cut off the single
straighter, nicely played down to long on
very full, almost a yorker, and dug out back to the bowler
full again, played with soft hands out to the leg side. Good, safe shot
very slow and the ball just holds up a touch, Tamim plays it to the off and in the air, but the ball is in the gap between mid off and extra cover
round the wicket to Tamim, flighted and he sweeps. Ball thuds into the front pad but its outside off and turning further away.
nicely played, soft hands and they run through
big turn from Swann! Finds the inside edge and loops up, but no fielder close enough on the leg side
swept, but can't get it away, straight to the fielder
full, batsman uses his feet and they pick up a single to long on
lots of turn again, but Tamim watches the ball well, just tapping it to the off side and covering the turn
slow and very short, Mushfiqur has a go at it but can only get a single
good, tight line on off stump, Collingwood gives Tamim nothing to work with
just a touch too wide, and Tamim uses the room to play the ball down to long off for a single
too much width given, Mushfiqur plays the ball nice and late and times it well, getting it past short third man and just beating the diving fielder for a welcome boundary
and he follows it up with an intelligent shot down to long on, the ball was straighter, allowing him to get inside it
good end to the over, Tamim has no pace, no bounce and no width to work with, and can't get the ball away
flighted and Mushfiqur goes for the sweep. Really tried to hit that hard, but couldn't get the timing
flighted on off stump, Tamim plays it with a straight bat down to long off

Run out! Mushfiqur what were you thinking? He taps it into the covers and runs straight away without looking at his partner, who started to run but stopped again almost immediately. Both batsmen end up at the non-striker's end. Silly, silly running there, and Bangladesh really didn't need that. This partnership was starting to look good.

Gone first ball! Straight, flighted and the ball grips and turns, stopping on the batsman as he tried to work it to leg. It takes the leading edge and loops to a short, straight-ish midwicket for the easiest of catches.
slightly quicker ball first up, and defended a little nervously to the off side
nice shot, timed with a high left elbow down to long off
good start from Bresnan, on a length, on a line, and defended
probing the off-stump line, and worked, slightly edgily down to third man for a single
smart fielding from Collingwood at point, diving to his right to intercept a firm cut shot
back of a length again and defended
neatly turned away from a fuller ball around middle and leg, down to fine leg for one
full and defended
given some air again, batsman stretches forward and defends
this time Iqbal clips it firmly through the leg side for a couple
worked away off a decent length for one
fuller and correctly pushed down the ground calmly for a single
nicely bowled, holding it back a touch, defended again
unlucky there for the bowler, or lucky for the batsman, or both, as a flash outside off stump finds the inside edge and skims past the stumps for four down to fine leg
full and pushed blocked firmly to the fielder
full toss goes unpunished, forced firmly to point where a misfield allows a single
short and pulled away well, timed nicely and played down, for a single
full and straight and neatly defended
too short and sails well over the batsman given as a wide
better ball to finish up, back of a length and defended
starts well enough, giving it some air outside off and defended
well, what a shot! Couple of steps down the track and swiped over midwicket for four
there it is, and how he deserves it, fantastic hundred from Tamim, celebrates with a hop and a jump
blocked off the front foot from a good delivery on the stumps
pushed into space for a single
tidy end to the over, defended from the front foot
good start for Sidebottom on return, tight on the stumps and blocked away
slower ball, Naeem tries to blaze it back down the ground but finds no timing and Sidebottom collects in his follow through
slightly shorter, allows Naeem to force it through point for a single
good change of pace, much slower, Tamim waits and prods it into the off side for one
switches to round the wicket, trying to cramp Naeem, but gets the angle wrong and shoves it too far down the leg side
shorter again, Naeem plays it well, pulling with full control to square leg for one
fuller and worked into the leg side from the front foot for a single
Pietersen continues and drifts down the leg side, clips Tamim's pads and scuttles down to fine leg, the batsmen cross for two, but there was plenty of confusion in the calling
nicely bowled, Tamim can only push it back to the bowler
down on one knee and sweeping hard down to deep square for a single
well bowled again, given some air and pushed back to Pietersen
slightly shorter, and some turn back into the right hander, Naeem manages to squeeze a cut shot out for one
Tamim keeps the strike by working this into the deep midwicket region
nicely bowled by Sidebottom, not giving Tamim much space, but he manages to dab a very delicate cut shot down to third man away
slower ball again, they'll be plenty of them, and turned to deep square for one
another open-faced dab down to third man, Tamim content to turn the strike over for now
that will do very nicely for Bangladesh, a puzzling short ball, with a bit of width and Naeem uppercuts finely for four wide of Prior
nicely done, working the ball away into the point region for one
high-quality shot, too much width from Sidebottom, Tamim thrashed it handsomely between extra cover and mid off to the boundary. Imperious stuff
Broad starts well, if a little short, but on off stump and defended
another short ball, which is pretty much a free run, pulled away for one, slightly uncomfortably, down to fine leg
persisting with this short-length attack, Tamim hangs back and flicks a pull away for one
back of a length once more, worked away for another single, good stuff from these two
neatly flicked off the back foot towards midwicket, where Pietersen tumbles as he fields
short again, and Tamim has played this work-down-to-third-man shot very well all day, angling it away to keep the strike
Tamim greets him with an enormous blow, straight back over his head for six, clearing Sidebottom on the long on boundary by a distance
brings up the 50 partnership with another well-timed shot into the leg side
turned into the leg side again, and more confusion with the running but they collect a single
pushed away with soft hands, allowing the ball to just hit the bat and it trickles away slowly to point, giving enough time for the batsmen to complete a single
with the damage done from the first ball Tamim is content to just tap it away for a single, much to the arm-flapping annoyance of Cook
easy single to finish up, pushing firmly to deep mid off
starts well, on off stump and pushed calmly towards point for one
thrown up, with enough width for Tamim to push his arms through it for a single down to long off
rotates the strike well again, pushing into the off side for one
oh dear, Tamim dabs a ball that was heading for leg stump to third man, almost undid him
gets the single comfortably here, pushed away into space for one
close once more, his checked-drive lands one-bounce short of shot extra cover
and with the bowling change comes a wicket! A full ball from Wright on off stump, Naeem makes a bit of room and drives into the covers, but picks out Eoin Morgan, who makes no mistake this time.
what a start! He marks his return to international cricket with a fine shot, getting a touch on a ball slipping down leg and helping it down to the fine leg boundary
better ball from Wright, Mashrafe squared up a little and can't get it away
Mortaza can't get this away either, clipped straight to midwicket
ooh, good ball, Wright grips it across the seam and the ball darts away a touch. Mortaza plays at it but it scoots past the outside edge
back of a length, on off stump, and Mortaza tries to drive it on the up but doesn't time the ball at all
good ball from Swann, full and straight and Tamim defends
he's slipped this one a bit too short and a little wide, and Tamim rocks back the flay the ball through the off side
Gone! Mortaza on the sweep first ball from Swann. That looked dead straight away, full and right on the stumps, he misses with the attempted sweep and the ball thuds into his front pad
round the wicket to Razzak, on the money from Swann and played defensively
on off stump again, played softly to the off side, no run
comes forward in defence once again, the ball misses his prod and hits the pad, half an appeal is quickly turned down by the umpire
Tamim makes room, stepping to leg but Broad follows him with a shortish ball on his hips, and he flicks it straight to Sidebottom at short fine leg
slower ball from Broad, Tamim has a massive swipe at it and hits out to the fielder on the boundary at midwicket. He turns down the single though

makes room again, trying to hit this one out of the stadium but he doesn't time it at all, the bottom hand comes off the bat and he's lucky that didn't carry to the fielder at mid on, really looped up

Gone! Tamim moves around again, stepping across to the off side this time and trying to paddle the ball down to fine leg. He telegraphed the movement though, and Broad speared the ball in to shatter the stumps
nasty, brutish short ball first up, and the ball whizzes past Shafiul's nose
follows it up with a much fuller ball, but it's outside off and Shafiul drives at it. Decent attempt, but he can't find the gap
Back of a length, on the hips and tucked away down to fine leg
just outside off on a length, Shafiul just hangs his bat out but can't get anything on it, the ball dying on its way through to the keeper
Top shot! He's done really well has Shafiul - short and wide but it had to be put away and he did it in style, cuttting and beating a trundling Sidebottom on the fence
he aims a flashing drive at the next one, but hit straight to the fielder in the covers. Good shot though
Shafiul makes some room, but Bresnan follows him and the ball also darts in a touch and he can't get it away
short and wide, Shafiul cuts and the ball flies off the top edge down to Sidebottom, who collects cleanly and hurls the ball back in
short again, Shafiul cuts but Collingwood swoops round from backward point to cut it off, great fielding
makes room again, chopping the ball down into the covers, where Luke Wright makes a good diving stop, but the batsmen sprint through for one
round the wicket, and Razzak clears his left leg out of the way and hoicks, but connects only with fresh air
shorter, but not much pace on that at all. Razzak lets it go through, leaving well alone
Broad drifts onto the pads, allowing Razzak to work the ball to leg. Every run is vital from here
what a shot from a no. 11! Broad's over is ruined slightly as Shafiul steps to leg and crashes a full ball straight back over Broad's head and the ball races to the boundary. Very welcome runs
Razzak clears his leg again and heaves to the leg side, but doesn't really time it at all. The batsmen run through though
hurled in at off stump, almost yorker length but Shafiul jams the bat down hard and they scamper a single
Razzak misses out as Sidebottom offers up a juicy full toss outside off. Probably just trying to hit that a little too hard.

inn2.comm: good start from Cook, turning a fullish ball from Mortaza through the leg side for a couple
Mortaza will be rusty on his comeback from injury but this is full and straight and blocked out to mid on
good line again, yorker length and dug out by Cook. Important innings for him and for England as run-scoring will be harder with the older ball
neatly clipped away through square leg as Mortaza drifts too full and on to the leg side
better ball to follow up, arrow straight and Cook can only defend
very nicely timed off the back foot, Mortaza too close to leg stump again and Cook pushed it firmly towards the straight-midwicket boundary
starts well, decent pace, on off stump and blocked into the covers
short and thrashed over midwicket, that is Cook's favourite shot
better length this time, fuller and defended into the leg side
finally locates the ideal line and length, full, just outside off stump and blocked confidently
too straight again, this will frustrate the captain, easily clipped away for another couple
Cook keeps the strike with another leg-side tickle, and Kieswetter's wait for his first ball in international cricket continues
well outside off stump, and Cook happily leaves alone, but not given a wide
Mortaza is definitely down on pace from his best, but has maintained a good line and Cook blocks it away
probing line around off stump, defended once more
finds the slightest hint of movement here, back into Cook, who inside-edges it towards square leg
outside off stump again, wideish and left alone
little too short, which allows, despite the tight line, Cook to cut it away to point for a couple which means Kieswetter will finally have strike
full and straight first up, driven firmly straight to short cover
action replay, keeps Kieswetter pinned on zero
hint of turn, Kieswetter looking edgy, good stuff from Shakib, full and defended
dropped So close for Shakib! Spun away, caught the edge and it went through the wicketkeeper's legs
well bowled again, defended from the front foot, top stuff from Shakib
oh dear! Trapped bang in front but somehow given not out, replays show it crashing into leg stump and Kieswetter is a very luck man
short and cut away from Cook for a single to point
takes a couple of steps down the track and times a drive through the covers for four, that will give him some confidence, top shot
edging down the track again, and pushing into the off side for one
tidy shot from Cook, just angling the bat and driving square on the off side, beats the fielder and races away for four, well timed
good recovery from Mortaza, full and straight and Cook can only defend
very good shot from Cook, read the slower ball, waited on it and timed beautifully though mid off for four
Kieswetter advances down the wicket and drives firmly to extra cover
down the wicket again, driving past the bowler for one to the fielder placed on the long off boundary
it's a very quick outfield here and Cook's gentle off-side push flies towards the boundary where smart fielding keeps it to two
another close call, edged through the slips for a boundary, unlucky for Shakib
neatly defended off the front foot
Cook lunging forward and calls a quick single, Kieswetter sends his captain back and there is almost a chance of a run out
floats it up and it's dug out to mid on
nicely bowled again here, Kieswetter advancing and almost yorks himself there
skipping down once more, Abdur saw him coming and fired it in, Kieswetter angles it through midwicket for a single
Cook trapped on his crease somewhat, blocks tentatively
excellent fielding from Mortaza on the deep-square boundary saves two as Cook heaved an excellent slog-sweep away
another big sweep shot, fielded well on the boundary. Captain Cook off to a flier here
greeted by a cut shot which Cook squeezes out from a tight off-stump line for a couple
nicely done from Cook, slightly overpitched from Naeem and Cook hauled it over midwicket for another boundary, good decisive stuff from the new captain
enormous appeal from Naeem, but this one was heading past the leg stump
oops, not particularly smart stuff from Naeem here. Bowls a good ball that Cook blocks back at him, he throws down the stumps and it rebounds for a couple
oh very close here, Cook cutting a ball that was heading for middle, doesn't time it
manages to find the single here, clipping into space
this is a little bit frantic  from Bangladesh, plenty of shouting, but Cook is looking very comfortable, clipping to mid on for a single
Kieswetter stands very still at the crease, before getting forward to defend
lovely shot this from Kieswetter and things are unravelling all too quickly for Bangladesh, down the wicket and driven past the bowler for four
forward and defending into the off side
bit of turn here from a slightly shorter length, Kieswetter back and defending
similar ball, shorter, straight and defended once more
starts tidily, on off stump, Cook forward and defending
attempted arm-ball goes slightly awry and too short, allowing Cook to pull it away
Kieswetter advancing again, shades of Damien Martyn, drives nicely into the off side
nicely bowled and defended from the crease by Cook
the ball really zipping off the wicket with the dew, not gripping, Cook is on the front foot defending
on the sweep again, times it well down to the fielder
skips down the pitch and pats it back to the bowler
defended with bat and pad together
on off stump, no turn, pushed firmly into the covers
tossed up a little more, Kieswetter uses his feet and drives down to long off
another hopeful appeal as Cook goes for a sweep but that looks like going down leg
width offered outside off, cut away through backward point and there's a sweeper back
round the wicket, pushed across the left hander who cuts it through the covers to sweeper to bring up a well-played fifty from 44 balls
hint of turn as this is lobbed into the leg side
flicked out to midwicket, nicely timed but straight to the fielder
dragged down a touch short, Cook waits on the back foot and whips it away through midwicket
angled in towards leg stump, comfortably tucked into the gap at midwicket to rotate the strike again
well, nearly the breakthrough as Cook gets a leading edge which loops out of the reach of Shakib in his follow through and also lands short of mid off...moment of fortune for Cook
round the wicket, pushed down towards long on...this is all fairly easy for the England batsmen
outside off, driven with an open face through cover where the sweeper does the work
dragged down short, basically a long hop, which is pulled out to deep midwicket
gone! A much-needed breakthrough for Bangladesh as Kieswetter gives Naeem the change and completely misses a drive, leaving Rahim with a simple stumping.
and he's away first ball as he forces this down to long on with a straight bat
turned out to midwicket to end a successful over
uses his feet to the Bangladesh captain, worked out to midwicket
pushed in towards leg stump, takes the pad into the on side
comes forward and defends from middle and off back down the pitch

well, well...how the game changes, Pietersen has gone, given out from an inside edge that took the pad and looped low to slip. He doesn't look happy with the decision and the first replay isn't clear, but Bangladesh won't care about that
tucked into the leg side
comes forward and defends, another good over for Bangladesh
driven firmly on the bounce to short cover...a crowd catch which gets everyone in the stands pretty excited
full on the stumps, worked through square leg
beaten outside off as he has a flat-footed poke
gets a thick outside down towards short third-man
chopped away through backward point
defended from middle to the off side
worked into his favourite gap through midwicket
played into the on side
worked away for another single as these two rotate the strike
can't find the gap on this occasion, good line from Shakib on middle and off
excellent work at cover to prevent any runs as Cook cut hards, Bangladesh have come alive with those two quick wickets
that's a good, tight over as the run rate continues to be hauled in
no spin as Collingwood pushes off the back foot and gets a thick outside edge to backward point
turn on this one, Collingwood waits in the crease and defends
pushed gently into the covers...Collingwood gauging conditions

drops short and Collingwood is quick to latch on, pulling through midwicket but the fielder does well to run from deep square to prevent the boundary, however then he fumbles his pick-up so the batsmen come back for three anyway
cut away through point
on middle and off, Collingwood leans forward and defends carefully
that beats everybody...Cook plays and misses and Rahim can't collect it either as another one goes between his legs
worked down to long on with a turn of wrists
pushed down the ground to long off
a fumble in the follow through allows another single down the ground. To be fair to Razzaq he got into a tangle with Cook's legs
there's a good understanding between these two as they collect another single to the leg side
waits in the crease and pushes out to midwicket
opens the face and finds the gap at square cover
flicked around the corner but short fine-leg prevents the run
pushed firmly up to mid on who is now back inside the circle, trying to build some more pressure
picks out the same man again...it makes the batsmen think differently
but a long hop is a long hop whatever the field and Cook easily dispatches this short ball through cover and there's no chance for the sweeper

the captain has gone, the crowd goes wild again. He prods forward on the front foot and is taken on the pad, a huge appeal is answered in the affirmative although replays suggest this one was going down the leg side
ooh, nearly a leading edge from Collingwood as he works to the leg side...this won't be easy for England
defended to the on side
down the pitch and defended to the man at short cover
down the pitch, over midwicket, confident shot from Collingwood to relieve some of the pressure...that's his area
takes the pad as he tries to work into the leg side
defended firmly into the covers
tossed up, a touch of turn but defended solidly by Morgan
speared way down leg, and rightly given wide there
just a little too short there, allowing Morgan to rock back and punch the ball away to leg for a single
wow that one has really kept low, Collingwood played it easily in the end though
tossed up and driven firmly into the covers
too short from Naeem, and he's given him some width as well, Collingwood cuts powerfully through the gap for a boundary behind point
much better line, Collingwood defends but that boundary really took the pressure off
great ball from Razzak, tight line and Morgan can't do anything with it
straightish and worked to midwicket, but straight to the fielder
tossed up just outside off, defended
very short outside the off stump, turns in sharply but Morgan cuts it away, fortunately for Bangladesh it's hit straight to the fielder
tapped back to the bowler, who collects cleanly
and again, full, straight and bunted back at Razzak
decent start, just back of a length on off stump, Collingwood gets nicely in line and plays the ball firmly into the off side
fuller this time, and Collingwood drives well but straight to Shakib at extra cover
Collingwood takes a couple of steps down the track and drives again, but straight at mid off. Trying to put some pressure on the bowler here
down the track again, and Shafiul slips the ball slightly too straight and into Collingwood's favourite area. Clipped powerfully over wide long on and a couple of bounces to the rope
good reply, back of a length and nice and straight, Collingwood defends
using his feet once again, but keeps the ball along the ground on the off side. Can't find the gap though
Morgan uses his feet, chips it in the air back to the bowler but bounces before it reaches Razzak. Good ball
full and straight again, Morgan pushes it back to Razzak
using his feet once again, Morgan collects this one on the full toss and works it powerfully away through midwicket. Just the one run though, as there's a sweeper out there
Collingwood comes down the track and turns his wrists over it, but finds the fielder at midwicket
stands back in his crease and works to midwicket once more, but finds the gap this time and the batsmen run through for one
lots of turn on that one, but he starts too straight and Morgan glances to fine leg... but straight at the fielder
good start, full and straight
pitched up again, Collingwood just having a look here, plays defensively
starts too straight and the turn takes it straighter, allowing Collingwood to work it to leg with ease. Risk free stroke there
just too short, Morgan waits in the crease and cuts behind point
well timed off the back foot into the covers, but can't find the gap

full and wide outside off, Collingwood throws the bat at this one. The ball takes the edge, though, and dribbles down towards short third man, just to the left of the fielder though and they run through for a tight single
coming round the wicket, well bowled, straight and Collingwood can only defend
using his feet very well here is Collingwood, but he can't get to the pitch and defends
well he got to the pitch of that one! Down the track once more, lofted handsomely over wide long on/midwicket and that bounces just inside the rope
lots of flight, Collingwood hangs back and waits for it, then bunts the ball down the ground with a straight bat and a high left elbow
Morgan using his feet as well, but doesn't get to the pitch and plays it down somewhat awkwardly
reverse sweep! Morgan pulls it off nicely, timing the ball very well behind the fielder at point and all the way to the boundary. Good shot, he's obviously had a lot of practice at it
really speared in, but he drops it short. Collingwood can't make the most of it though, pulling away to midwicket
gives this one a bit more air, Morgan works it straight to the midwicket fielder
oh, close one this! Morgan shapes for the reverse sweep, changes his mind and tries the paddle, hit on the pads but the umpire's not interested in the appeal
much more orthodox attempt at the paddle sweep, but he can't find the gap
timed! Effortlessly placed between the fielders at extra cover and cover, races away all along the carpet for a classy boundary
tucks him up slightly, Morgan tries to drop the ball on the leg side but puts it too close to the fielder to risk a run
straightish, worked away without any danger by Collingwood. The pressure is coming off here
Morgan comes down the track, pushes the ball firmly down to a deep mid on and another easy single
Collingwood comes down the track and once again slams the ball powerfully over wide long on. Totally in control there, it's his favourite area!
shorter on off stump, quicker too, but Collingwood can't find the gap behind point
so he goes infront of point as Razzak drops it short again, easy two
too straight this time, Collingwood leans on the ball and sends it down wide of the fielder at fine leg to keep the strike
good start with the new ball, on off stump and Collingwood defends
just a touch too short, Collingwood forces the ball through the gap in the covers
more easy runs, Collingwood works a ball on leg stump onto the leg side.
hit straight to mid on, no run
and again, almost identical ball and shot, and same result
outside off and Collingwood times a drive off the back foot, but hit straight to the fielder at cover
on off stump, no turn and Morgan drops it wide of the fielder for another single
arm ball comes in to Collingwood's pads. He didn't seem to pick it at all, jabbing down at the ball awkwardly, but got enough on it to get a single
on Morgan's legs, but hit straight to the fielder at square leg
this one turns a bit, but that allows Morgan to push it wide of midwicket and pick up another run
Collingwood waits in his crease, and works a straight ball onto the leg side
straight again but Morgan can't get it away
drives off the back foot down to long on for an easy single
Morgan hasn't quite found fluency yet, skips down the wicket and misses an attempted leg-side heave
timed this well though, off the back foot and controlling a cover drive perfectly for a well-timed boundary
oh dear! More mishaps from the the wicketkeeper, Morgan ran past a quicker ball and was miles down the wicket but the stumping chance was spilled
connects this time, pushing into space for a single
defended off the front foot
this one stops in the wicket a fraction and Collingwood scoops it back down towards the bowler he tumbles as he fields
massive appeal from one that looked as if it caught the inside edge, on to the pads and to the wicketkeeper. This time Mushfiqur caught the chance but the umpire turned it down, looked like he hit it
this time it is pushed into space more comfortably
just angled the bat and dropped into space on the off side
nicely played, reverse-sweeping with utter conviction for a couple
defended off the back foot
keeps the strike with a single into the off side
cutting from a ball that was tight on off stump, manages to squeeze it nicely and collects one
the ball stopping on the pitch a little, Collingwood is back and defending
good delivery, full and on off stump, Collingwood defends
very neatly done by Collingwood, down the track and shoved between long on and deep midwicket for another boundary
quicker ball, Collingwood rocks back and defends
another shortish and quicker ball, Collingwood turns it into the leg side to bring up a very well played fifty
shortish delivery, Collingwood back and tries to cut but finds the fielder at cover
aims another cut but it's too close to him and he blocks it away
well bowled again, pinning Collingwood to the crease, but he squeezes it away for one
Morgan rotates the strike, pushing calmly away for one
pushed to mid on and Collingwood sets off straight away for a sharp single
good finish to the over from Morgan, swishing away his sweep shot well and it goes down to the square-leg boundary
floated up and Collingwood and bashed away into the off side from the front foot, but straight to the cover fielder
runs beginning to flow quite easily now, this careers away off the outside edge down to the third man boundary
blocked this time into space for another single
good stuff from Morgan, pushing down the ground for a riskless single
a bit short, Collingwood rocks back to cut but doesn't time it at all
shortish again, Collingwood aims a pull, gets it away nicely and picks up a single
tossed up by Shakib, Collingwood makes room but the ball comes in to him and he can't get it away
leading edge! Colly totally beaten in the flight there as he came down the wicket, the ball loops up but over the fielder at cover, falling into space
skids on with the arm, not picked again by Collingwood. Very little bounce as well, but he jabs the bat down just in time
straighter, hit to mid off but can't find the gap
defended into the covers and they steal another easy single
too straight, clipped into the gap in front of square on the leg side by Morgan

he's done it! Morgan gone to the first ball of the spell! Tossed up on off stump, Morgan drives very hard at the ball but hits it in the air and Aftab Ahmed clings on to a stinging chance at extra cover. Well held catch, that was hit very hard
Prior gets inside a straight one first ball and attempts to work it away to leg, can't find the gap though
very watchful in defence as the ball is tossed up
and again, defended onto the leg side this time, but no run
Prior walks into a defensive shot
on the sweep, and he's timed that to perfection. The fielder at midwicket managed to get round to square leg but the ball sped past him and over the ropes. Pressure-relieving shot for Prior
too straight from Razzak, Collingwood eases the ball into the gap behind square
short and wide outside off, the ball grips and turns as well, taking it further. Prior cuts it away in the air but straight through the gap and out to the sweeper
play and a miss on an attempted cut there, the lack of bounce is what deceived him though
too straight again, and flicked into the gap on the leg side
pitched up and Prior drives, but doesn't get the timing or placement he's looking for
wide, but not too short - Prior cuts though, but the ball goes straight to the fielder at short third man
really tossed up, dropped onto the leg side but no run taken
a couple of steps down the track and theres that chip shot once again. The timing wasn't great, however, so couldn't find the bounbdary
pushed into the off side, the fielder collects cleanly
down the track and another chip to wide long on, Naeem screams "catch it!" but that was never going to reach the fielder
flighted and met with watchful defence
down the track once more and chipped down to long on, Collingwood just making it look so easy out there
dropped short and pulled powerfully away, but the fielder patrolling on the midwicket fence collects
quicker ball, Prior defends to leg
Quickish again, but sliding down leg and Prior gets a tickle on it to send the ball just wide of fine leg
tossed up outside off, a touch of turn as Collingwood slashes hard at the ball. It takes the outside half of the bat but straight to short third man
much too short, but Collingwood can't capitalise as the ball comes off the toe end of his bat and goes straight to the fielder at cover
better ball, fuller, but Collingwood knows he has the time to just defend, very little pressure in the middle
tossed up on middle and off, defended
some turn there, but not much bounce, and Prior clips the ball firmly through square leg for a couple
moves inside the line to change the angle, and works the ball to leg once again, just a single this time though
Collingwood comes down the track but Naeem sees him coming and pulls the ball down shorter, can't stop the single though
Prior using his feet as well, and good running gets them two from a bunt down to long on
just a bit too straight, Prior gets inside it and works the ball wide of the midwicket fielder for a single
and he starts with a shortish ball on middle stump, no pace on it at all though, but Collingwood finds the mid on fielder
similar ball, but this one bounces much more to surprise Prior, taking the shoulder of the bat as he tries to ride the bounce
better ball, on off stump and defended
Prior pushes a straight ball down to long on for an easy single
no pace from Mortaza, that was 121kph, Collingwood gets behind it and forces the ball to long off
Prior hangs his bat at one outside off stump, dropping the ball near his feet on the off side and they scamper through
full, straight ball, and Prior works it down to long on. Too easy, too many spaces and no pressure being brought on the batsmen
speared in towards leg stump, the turn takes it further and Collingwood tucks it off his pad towards fine leg
decent ball and Prior respects it, defending watchfully
tossed up, full and wide outside off stump and Prior hammers the ball away on bended knee. The cover fielder got a hand to it but that was really hammered
good reply, and Prior defends off the back foot
straighter ball, Prior gets inside the ball again, working it away to leg with ease
short on leg stump, Prior tucks the ball off his hips down to the fielder on the fine leg fence
back of a length on off stump, Collingwood calmly gets in line to drive off the back foot, but straight to the mid off fielder
width given, but Collingwood's slashing cut goes straight to backward point. Good shot for no runs
dances down the track and aims a heave over midwicket, but the ball takes the inside edge and trickles away as they steal a run
Prior advances as well, meeting the ball on the half volley and hitting it back past Mortaza, but mid off runs round to cut the ball off
advancing again, a touch of away movement but Prior covers it easily, playing the ball off the face down to third man
Prior hangs back in the crease and works the ball to the on side, but straight to mid on
flashes hard outside off stump, the bat twisting in his hands. Prior was going for the boundary but tried to hit it too hard
no room given as Collingwood tries to work the ball away
gets his front foot down the pitch and forces the ball easily down to long on
no rush from Prior, dropping the ball on the leg side
tucked off his pads into space, another scampered single
full toss hammered down the ground, and a shocking misfield gives Prior a boundary. That really should have been stopped, fielders are obviously demoralised
yorker length ball dug out by Prior. Good ball, but all slightly pointless at this stage. Good practice for Mortaza after injury I suppose
another good yorker, but no pace on it and easily dug out by Prior
full again, half-volley though, and shovelled down to long on
another full toss, just a single down to long on though
full ball, Collingwood comes down the track and taps the ball into the covers, an easy single gives England the win!
